lexUnit.name: grief.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: intense sorrow, especially caused by someone's death.

sentence.text: Sometimes our bodies and minds seek excuses to experience griefs that we may have put aside or denied because we could n't face them at the time .
She had assumed that because mother had n't wept or shown grief that her father had n't been loved by anyone but herself and her father 's parents , who wept copiously .
I experienced tears of real grief for the first time when my granny died .

Amanda 's grief for her father was compounded by anxiety over his ontological status .
A 16-year-old girl works herself into a frenzy of grief for a friend killed by right-wing vigilantes .
